metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3206 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The checkPassword function in python-kerberos does not authenticate the KDCit attempts to communicate with, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (bad response), or have other unspecified impact byperforming a man-in-the-middle attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3206` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-kerberos - 1.1.5-2build3
python3-kerberos - 1.1.5-2build3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pykerberos package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.5-2build3').
